abstract: The economy appears to be in a cyclical recovery that is gaining strength. Companies have begun to hire and consumer spending seems to be accelerating, Floyd Norris writes in his latest column in The New York Times, so it is surprising that many doubt such a thing could possibly be happening.
snippet: The economy appears to be in a cyclical recovery that is gaining strength. Companies have begun to hire and consumer spending seems to be accelerating, Floyd Norris writes in his latest column in The New York Times, so it is surprising that many d...
lead_paragraph: The United States economy appears to be in a cyclical recovery that is gaining strength. Companies have begun to hire, and consumer spending seems to be accelerating, Floyd Norris writes in his latest column in The New York Times.

headline.main: Norris: Numbers Point to a Recovery
